companies_research.name: Google
companies_research.reason: Google has announced two new AI chips, the Tensor 3 and the Edge TPU 3, which are set to be utilized in the next generation of Pixel phones. The announcement reflects Google's advancements in AI technology and positions them strategically within the competitive AI chip market.

companies_research.name: Advanced Micro Devices
companies_research.reason: AMD announced a strategic partnership with OpenAI to deploy up to 6 gigawatts of AMD GPUs. This partnership is expected to boost AMD's revenue significantly, with a projection of over $2 billion in sales from its new AI chip lineup next year. The agreement underscores AMD's growing presence in the AI sector and marks a significant move against competitors like Nvidia.

companies_research.name: Anthropic
companies_research.reason: Anthropic has secured a substantial deal with Google Cloud to leverage up to one million TPUs, a collaboration valued at tens of billions. This partnership aims to expand Anthropic's AI capabilities and reflects the broader trend of integrating AI solutions within cloud infrastructures.
